issues.description: The problem statement (UML and text) requires SealSaloon.calculateTotalPrice(Meal) to return a double ("calculate the net cost of the meal with double precision" and UML shows : double). The solution implementation declares calculateTotalPrice as returning int (public static int calculateTotalPrice(Meal)). This is a return-type mismatch: students implementing the method to match the specification (double) would produce a different signature than the solution, and automated tests that expect a double result/signature may fail or cause confusion.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the calculateTotalPrice method in the solution to return double and compute using double precision. For example: public static double calculateTotalPrice(Meal meal) { double sum = 0.0; for (var x : meal.getIngredients()) { StockIngredient ingredient = stock.findStockIngredient(x); if (ingredient != null) { sum += (double) ingredient.getPrice(); } } return sum; } Also ensure any references and tests expect a double return type.
